page.title: 05Transport: trains
page.content: {Trains} are used to transport goods and people around the country. A locomotive pulls a train of carriages or wagons on rails. Locomotives have diesel, diesel electric or gas turbine engines. {High speed trains,} powered by gas turbines, pass non-stop through Cholsey. These are fast trains which go east to London or west to Wales and the South West. Slower, stopping trains will also call at Didcot making connections to many other parts of the country. Before diesel electric power, trains were pulled by steam engines but they are not so economical. At present steam trains are used only for pleasure. The old Wallingford to Cholsey line is now being restored by the Cholsey and Wallingford Railway Preservation Society and an old steam engine has been bought, to be renovated prior to use on the track.
